CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 27, 1950, pg. 1 reads: "Shot In Neck - William E. Gardner, 30, 504 Junilla Street, is shown in his room at Mercy Hospital with a nurse, after doctors completed removal of a bullet which went in the left side and lodged on the right side of his neck. Gardner said Fire Capt. Joseph Watts shot him in an argument over parking a car in a driveway between his house and Watts' home. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Shooting victim William E. Gardner, lying in hospital bed, with nurse standing on right, in Mercy Hospital
